instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage - High fan > Boot Chime > Shutdown
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage - High fan > Boot Chime > Shutdown

Once charger in plugged in, immediate high fan seconds later boot chime then 3-4 seconds later shutdown. No Green light.

Where to start on this one?

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage - High fan > Boot Chime > Shutdown
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage - High fan > Boot Chime > Shutdown
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?? For future reference, does boot chime imply this??

So it looks like the keyboard was shorted and making it restart. Now to solve other issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damage - High fan > Boot Chime > Shutdown
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is one of the power rails on the board , you can find the voltage on the rail using a multi meter. Chime . Aka the sound emitted by a healthy macbook right after powering on
